definition: to tolerate or accommodate oneself to
details:
verb
- to tolerate or accommodate oneself to
= example: to tolerate or accommodate oneself to
= synonyms: swallow
- to consider or hold as true
= example: to consider or hold as true
- to be sexually responsive to, used of a female domesticated mammal
= example: to be sexually responsive to, used of a female domesticated mammal
- to react favorably to
= example: to react favorably to
- to give an affirmative reply to
= example: to give an affirmative reply to
= synonyms: consent
- to receive officially, as a report from a committee
= example: to receive officially, as a report from a committee
- to receive willingly something given or offered
= example: to receive willingly something given or offered
= synonyms: take
- to admit into a group or community
= example: to admit into a group or community
= synonyms: take
- to take on as one's own the expenses or debts of another person
= example: to take on as one's own the expenses or debts of another person
= synonyms: bear
- to be designed to hold or take
= example: to be designed to hold or take
= synonyms: take
